abstract: In this episode of "The Good Wife," the lawyers one-up each other in the connections game.
snippet: In this episode of "The Good Wife," the lawyers one-up each other in the connections game.
lead_paragraph: A rare occurrence on "Affairs of State," the season's sixth episode of "The Good Wife" on Sunday night: Alicia Florrick was unequivocally on the wrong side of the case. She and the new associate, Caitlin, defended a Taiwanese student who was a suspect in a rape and murder aboard a party boat. The story seemed to revolve around the question of diplomatic immunity (in this case, the lack thereof), but that was a MacGuffin. In the final minutes we and Alicia discovered that she had been defending the killer.

headline.main: 'Good Wife' Watch: It's All About Connections
